name: Contemporary Issues in Higher Education
description: This course explores the debates and discussions centered on a selection of contemporary issues in postsecondary education in Canada and elsewhere. This may include topics such as the massification and corporatization of higher education, the reliance on sessional labour for instruction, and trends towards credentialism. The course combines instructor- and student-led discussions and inquiry. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5, SOC222H5, 1.0 SOC credit at the 300 level
